The US Treasury Department confirmed Tuesday that Elon Musk’s government efficiency team has been given “read-only” access to “coded data” of the government’s payments system.

site_title: Australia’s CBA first-half profit beats estimates on strong asset quality, lending volume growth
summary: Australia's Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA) reported a first-half cash profit of A$5.13 billion, beating estimates and surpassing its own previous record. Lending volume growth and lower provisions for bad debts contributed to the result, while higher technology costs offset some gains. The bank's home-lending portfolio remains well-secured, with most customers ahead on scheduled repayments. Despite beating expectations, CBA's shares fell 0.9% in early trading, raising questions about the bank's lofty valuation.

images.alt_text: Signage for Commonwealth Bank of Australia atop it's Darling Square office in Sydney, Australia, on Monday, Oct. 28, 2024. The domestic economy remains fundamentally sound with several structural advantages that provide optimism for the future, the bank's Chief Executive Officer Matt Comyn said at the annual meeting this month. Photographer: Brendon Thorne/Bloomberg
Commonwealth Bank of Australia said It retains around 5 per cent of the shares on issue in VIB.

site_title: Of global ambitions, product differentiation and ‘honest pricing’: China’s lifestyle brands aim to conquer the world
summary: China's lifestyle brands, Boloni, Goelia, and Anta, are expanding globally with a focus on product differentiation, modular construction, and "honest pricing." Boloni's modular carpentry solutions offer efficiency and quality, while Goelia's apparel brand features premium materials and traditional Chinese silk. Anta, China's biggest sporting goods brand, has grown rapidly with a focus on performance sportswear and technology. All three companies aim to conquer the world market, with plans for new showrooms and expansion into major markets, including Tokyo, Paris, and Dubai.

images.alt_text: Boloni's new 5,000 square foot flagship showroom. The brand is targeting the high-end residential market.
Xtra's UHNW Chinese clients favour brands like Tom Dixon, whose Melt modern lights are pictured here.

site_title: Keppel’s new South Central tower in Tg Pagar snares Manulife as anchor tenant
summary: Keppel's 33-storey commercial tower, Keppel South Central, in Tg Pagar has been completed with Manulife as its anchor tenant. The 650,000 sq ft property features smart building management systems and renewable energy, and has been awarded a Green Mark certification for low energy use. About 50% of the units are leased or being considered, with tenants expected to move in progressively from June. Keppel is working with AI solution providers to make the building AI-ready in the future.

images.alt_text: Janice Lim
Keppel DC Singapore 7 and 8, located in the Keppel Data Centre Campus at 82 Genting Lane. Basic earnings per share is up 41.9 per cent at S$0.349, from S$0.246 previously.
KIT's distribution of S$0.0125 for the fourth quarter will be paid out on Feb 18, after the record date on Feb 11.
Its gross revenue slipped 3.7 per cent to US$72.1 million from US$74.8 million while its net property income declined 14.1 per cent to US$36.3 million from US$42.2 million.

site_title: Tanjong Rhu, Queenstown, Chencharu flats offered in HDB’s Feb BTO launch
summary: The Housing and Development Board (HDB) launched 10,622 flats for sale in its February 2025 Build-To-Order (BTO) exercise, including 5,032 new flats and 5,590 Sale of Balance Flats (SBF). Prices range from S$108,000 for a two-room flexi flat in Yishun to S$554,000 for a four-room unit in Queenstown. Eight out of 10 BTO flats have waiting times of four years or under, with some projects, such as Chencharu Vines in Yishun, having shorter waiting times of just over three years.

images.alt_text: Therese Soh

site_title: Article misrepresents StarHub’s performance and strategy
summary: A StarHub spokesperson has responded to an article claiming that the telco gained 2.4 subscribers for every subscriber it lost to Simba in 2024, citing Opensignal's market insights report. However, the spokesperson argues that this conclusion is based on app usage patterns from a subset of the market and not actual subscriber migration data, making the claim unreliable.

images.alt_text: Opensignal’s data showed that Simba has grown from serving 487,000 subscribers at the end of H1 FY22 to 1.1 million subscribers as at H2 FY24.

site_title: SGX seeing ‘improved momentum’ in IPO pipeline, hopeful that listings will exceed last year’s
summary: Singapore Exchange (SGX) sees improved momentum in its initial public offering (IPO) pipeline, with more companies expressing interest in listing on the bourse. The bourse operator hopes to exceed last year's 4 IPOs with nearly 17% returns in 2024, despite having 20 delistings. To revive the local market, the Monetary Authority of Singapore has set up an equities market review group to address structural issues and encourage listings. Companies in the "sweet spot" of market caps are increasingly interested in listing in Asia, particularly in Singapore.

images.alt_text: SGX’s H1 net profit rises 20.7% to S$340 million following high growth in all revenue segments
SGX could emulate other exchanges to attract more tech listings here.

site_title: Europe: Shares end lower as trade war worries spike; automakers slide
summary: Europe's stocks closed lower on Friday, with automakers among the top decliners, as investors grew concerned about a potential global trade war escalating. US President Donald Trump announced plans to impose reciprocal tariffs on many countries next week, while China retaliated with targeted surcharges on US imports. Despite this, the Stoxx 600 index is up 0.5% for the week, driven by positive quarterly corporate reports from companies like ArcelorMittal and Novo Nordisk. The European Central Bank set a neutral deposit rate range of 1.75-2.25%, and the US Federal Reserve is expected to keep interest rates unchanged until June.

images.alt_text: The Stoxx 600 index closed 1.17 per cent higher at 544.84 points on Thursday, with benchmark indexes in Germany, France, Italy and Spain up about 1.5 per cent each.

site_title: Market Focus Daily: Tuesday, February 4, 2025
summary: Asian stocks surged on Tuesday, boosted by US President Donald Trump's delay of tariffs on Mexico and Canada. However, China retaliated by imposing tariffs on US goods after Trump imposed new levies. In other news, Indonesia approved a bill to establish a Temasek-style investment firm managing 1 trillion rupiah in assets, and Grab and GoTo are expected to merge this year.

images.alt_text: While Singapore is unlikely to be on the “hit list for direct tariffs” from the US, the city-state could still be affected indirectly if there is any “degradation” in economic integration, global supply chains and world trade, Minister for Foreign Affairs Vivian Balakrishnan said in Parliament on Tuesday.
Asian stock markets advanced with Hong Kong up more than three per cent, while Tokyo, Seoul and Manila were all more than one per cent higher.

Additional 10 per cent tariff across all Chinese imports into the US came into effect at 12.01 am ET on Tuesday (0501 GMT) after Trump repeatedly warned Beijing it was not doing enough to halt the flow of illicit drugs into the US.

Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto looks on during a meeting with US President Joe Biden in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington, DC, on November 12, 2024. (Photo by Brendan SMIALOWSKI / AFP)
The unprofitable firms have held on-and-off talks for years, targeting a combination that would reduce costs and competitive pressure in the region.

site_title: Staying invested even as trade war fears rattle markets
summary: US President Donald Trump has imposed 25% tariffs on goods from Mexico and Canada, and 10% on imports from China. The tariffs, set to take effect on February 4, aim to punish the countries for their alleged failure to prevent undocumented migrants and illegal drugs from entering the US. The move is expected to disrupt over $2.1 trillion in annual US trade with the three countries, potentially raising prices for food, housing, and petrol for Americans. The tariffs may also have significant implications for the auto and energy sectors, and could lead to a slowdown in the US economy and increased inflation.

images.alt_text: Asian markets were in negative territory after Trump ordered 25 per cent tariffs on Canadian and Mexican imports and 10 per cent on goods from China starting on Tuesday.
Trump's tariffs triggered market turmoil on Monday.

site_title: Grab weighs takeover of rival GoTo at US$7 billion valuation
summary: Grab Holdings and GoTo Group are accelerating merger talks, targeting a deal this year, with a potential valuation of over US$7 billion. The two unprofitable firms, the largest ride-hailing providers in South-east Asia, aim to reduce costs and competitive pressure by combining. A possible all-stock purchase could value GoTo shares at over 100 rupiah apiece, a 20% premium. The deal, which has been discussed for years, faces hurdles including antitrust obstacles and potential disagreements between the parties.

images.alt_text: Oxford calculated the direct GDP contribution using the sum of Grab’s earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortisation, wages paid to employees, and taxes incurred.

VinFast had signed an MOU with Gojek last year to provide an electric vehicle fleet in Indonesia. However, with little progress on the collaboration, VinFast chose to independently launch Xanh SM in the country.

site_title: BYD to drive Apac growth with mainstream rather than luxury focus: regional sales manager
summary: BYD, a China carmaker, plans to focus on boosting export numbers in the Asia-Pacific region by concentrating on mainstream models rather than luxury ones. The company has introduced premium brand Denza and previewed its luxury brand Yangwang, but mainstream models are expected to form the bulk of regional sales for the next few years, with Denza's sales not expected to be major. There are no immediate plans to introduce Yangwang to the region, according to BYD Auto's general manager of Asia-Pacific sales.

images.alt_text: Derryn Wong
The Yangwang U8 sport utility vehicle on display at the Japan Mobility Show in late 2023.
BYD is targeting sales of between five and six million EVs and hybrid cars this year, up from 4.27 million delivered last year.

Grab on Wednesday announced its partnership with BYD to expand its electric vehicle fleet in South-east Asia.
Factoring in parallel imports, Toyota was the top selling car brand in Singapore, but BYD was number one in authorised dealer sales.
BYD is a big player in this powertrain technology in China.

site_title: Gordon Tang and wife extend closing date of cash offer for Suntec Reit to Feb 7
summary: Gordon Tang and his wife have extended the closing date of their mandatory conditional cash offer for Suntec Real Estate Investment Trust (Reit) to February 7, at 5:30 pm. The offer price remains unchanged at S$1.16 per unit, and the offeror does not intend to increase the price. The offeror owns over 35.6% of Suntec Reit's issued units, and the offer will turn unconditional once it owns 50% or more of the trust's total units.

images.alt_text: Megan Cheah
The offer was first made on Dec 5 last year, at S$1.16 per unit.
Leasing activities in quality office developments in Singapore improved in Q4 2024, JLL data shows.
The revised offer marks a 2.6 per cent improvement from the initial offer of S$1.16 apiece made on Dec 5 last year.

site_title: Watch the gold price as trade wars become the new statecraft
summary: US President Donald Trump's tariff war with China has sparked a global economic uncertainty, leading to a surge in gold prices. The US-China trade war, paused partially, may be a proxy for the global geopolitical outlook, with gold serving as a hedge against risk. China, though hit by previous tariffs and sanctions, has shown restraint and is reorienting its trade links to the Global South, with exports to developing countries increasing. As global tensions rise, the gold price is soaring, reaching all-time highs above $2,800 an ounce, underscoring its role as a natural store of value.

images.alt_text: Mohan Kuppusamy
FILE PHOTO: Gold bars are displayed to be photographed at bullion house in Mumbai December 3, 2009. REUTERS/Arko Datta/File Photo
Global bullion banks are flying gold into the United States from trading hubs catering to Asian consumers.

site_title: India budget opts for economic sugar rush over reform
summary: India's budget prioritizes short-term economic relief through middle-class tax cuts over long-term reforms needed to reignite rapid growth. The government scaled back capital spending and infrastructure, disappointing analysts and markets. Forecasted GDP growth is expected to slip to a four-year low of 6.4% in the current financial year, with economists urging deeper interventions in agricultural markets, human capital, and ease of doing business to reach 8% growth. The budget's focus on consumption over capital expenditure risks stagnation, with economists warning that reforms are essential to regain high growth rates and assure jobs.

images.alt_text: A vegetable vendor sits beside a bonfire on his handcart on a cold winter evening in New Delhi on January 6, 2025. (Photo by Sajjad HUSSAIN / AFP)

The infusion takes the amount poured into India’s banking system to US$7.3 billion in the past two days and is part of the Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI) broader US$18 billion plan to address the tightness in domestic money markets.

site_title: Tariffs and the US’ fentanyl problem
summary: US President Donald Trump's threatened tariffs on China, Mexico, and Canada are aimed at countering the flow of fentanyl into the US, but critics argue this approach is misguided and may even be counterproductive. Fentanyl addiction is demand-driven, and the US needs to focus on tackling demand through investment in rehabilitation programs, job creation, and social engagement. Imposing tariffs may push prices up, leading to increased violence and smuggling, and may not benefit US consumers. A more effective approach would prioritize addressing the root cause of addiction, rather than blaming other countries for the US' fentanyl problem.

images.alt_text: Student drawn signs hang on the lockers inside the Alamo Navajo Community School on the Alamo Navajo reservation in Southern New Mexico, U.S., January 15, 2025.  REUTERS/Adria Malcolm
TOPSHOT - US President Donald Trump speaks to the press after signing an executive order in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington, DC on January 31, 2025. (Photo by Mandel NGAN / AFP)

After calls with Donald Trump (centre) just hours before the US tariffs were due to take effect, both Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau (left) and Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum (right) struck deals for a postponement.

China’s exports in key industries, including autos, have been growing faster in volume than value, suggesting manufacturers are discounting to try to win overseas sales when demand at home has been sputtering.

site_title: China to probe Google over anti-monopoly violations
summary: China's State Administration for Market Regulation announced it will probe Google for suspected anti-monopoly law violations, following the US's 10% tariff on Chinese goods. This move comes as Beijing adds US companies, including PVH and Illumina, to a list of "unreliable entities" that will face economic penalties. Google's core search engine and services are blocked in mainland China, and the company has largely exited the Chinese market since 2011. The investigation is seen as retaliation against US trade measures.

images.alt_text: The DOJ has also sought to curtail Google’s advances in AI as a remedy in a federal case that found its search business to be an illegal monopoly.

site_title: Trump says Israel would hand over Gaza after fighting, no US troops needed
summary: US President Donald Trump announced that Israel would hand over the Gaza Strip to the US after fighting ends, with no US troops needed on the ground. This move sparked international condemnation, with Saudi Arabia rejecting the proposal outright and Jordan's King Abdullah saying Palestinians would not sell their land. Trump's plan, which includes resettling Gaza's population in safer communities, has been met with criticism from Palestinians and hardline Israeli politicians. The move has raised concerns about the impact on ceasefire talks and the potential for forced displacement of Palestinians, a war crime under the 1949 Geneva Conventions.

images.alt_text: U.S. President Donald Trump speaks during the annual National Prayer Breakfast at the U.S. Capitol in Washington, U.S., February 6, 2025. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque

site_title: Citi Private Bank hires Hoo Peng Han as it rebuilds family office team in Asia
summary: Citi Private Bank has hired Hoo Peng Han as a director of its global family office group in Asia, rebuilding its team after several high-profile departures. Hoo brings 10 years of investment banking experience and a deep understanding of the Asia-Pacific family office ecosystem. He will focus on deal origination and syndication in Asia South, playing a critical role in delivering Citi's offerings to key clients. The move comes after former executives, including the former Asia head of family office advisory and global family office group head for South Asia, joined rival banks.

images.alt_text: Therese Soh
